channel.title: Sendframe126
channel.description:
Hey guys.
In the source Devolution, I can use the sendFrame126(text, 6570).
However in Battlescape, most sendFrames work but not 6570. Is this client sided? If so how can I add the sendFrame126 into Battlescape?

item.title: Sendframe126
item.dc:creator: @razorback razorback
item.description:
@razorback wrote:

Okay. Thank you anyway. I repped you

Read full topic

item.title: Sendframe126
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

razorback:

In Devolution, there is a player count at top of screen in ID 6590. In battlescape there is nothing in that spot. In trying to add text there. Sorry for lack of clarity on my behalf.

Don’t be sorry, I’m difficult when it comes to understanding situations.

I love the initiative you’ve taken so far in order to do this. Anyways, battlescape and devolution use different clients and as such their methods will vary. I’m once again assuming battlescape has a sendFrame126 and as such the reason why that player count isn’t showing up there is because it’s the wrong stringId for battlescape.

I can’t help you more than that because I don’t know the stringId nor would I know how to get it. If you can think of an interface within RuneScape that shows up there then you could do an interface dump, search for the Id for that interface, open that interface in an interface editor and well-ah you would have that String Id. Other than that I’m out of ideas, sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: Sendframe126
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

razorback:

Hmmm. Well it is currently blank. Which means the ID 6570 won’t be present. I have to add it myself using the given method. However, nothing happens. I can do it with other IDs such as 2438. I’ll keep looking. Thank you for the help!

Wait, I don’t think I’ve given you the right advice in the least bit…

What do you mean it’s blank? I thought you had this spanning across the top of your screen: “It is text in the middle-top of screen, used to display how many players are online.”

Do you or do you not have a player count showing on the screen? I assumed you did and you wanted to remove it.

Read full topic

item.title: Sendframe126
item.dc:creator: @razorback razorback
item.description:
@razorback wrote:

Hmmm. Well it is currently blank. Which means the ID 6570 won’t be present. I have to add it myself using the given method. However, nothing happens. I can do it with other IDs such as 2438. I’ll keep looking. Thank you for the help!

Read full topic

item.title: Sendframe126
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“razorback, post:5, topic:438112”]No it exists in Devolution. It is text in the middle-top of screen, used to display how many players are online.

In battlescape that ID does not make any text appear there. But some others do. I cannot find a means to add sendframe Ids. Do you know of any such way?[/quote]

sendFrame126("", stringId); as far as I’m aware is used to edit cache packed interfaces and their content. That sounds to me like it’s custom and hard-coded. That sounds a lot like on the old allstarscape sources where at the top ALLSTARSCAPE in alternating white and green colors was shown. Check your classes for this, as I’m pretty sure it’s hardcoded. I’m not sure what classes exist in devolution, but if you have a program capable of searching all files at once (eclipse) for that string, I’m sure you’d find it.

Read full topic

item.title: Sendframe126
item.dc:creator: @razorback razorback
item.description:
@razorback wrote:

No it exists in Devolution. It is text in the middle-top of screen, used to display how many players are online.

In battlescape that ID does not make any text appear there. But some others do. I cannot find a means to add sendframe Ids. Do you know of any such way?

Read full topic

item.title: Sendframe126
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

razorback:

Oh no it is the text slot within an interface! For example the logout button text is 2438 I think.

Aha, yes, that’s what I meant, sorry.

Anyways, what is 6570 supposed to be anyways? If it’s just this particular string that’s not working and other strings are within your source, I’m thinking this one string might not exist within devolution (random idea).

Read full topic

item.title: Sendframe126

item.title: Sendframe126
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“razorback, post:1, topic:438112”]Hey guys.

In the source Devolution, I can use the sendFrame126(text, 6570).

However in Battlescape, most sendFrames work but not 6570. Is this client sided? If so how can I add the sendFrame126 into Battlescape?[/quote]

I’ve never looked into devolution, but in PI sendFrame126("", interfaceId); is how the method is set-up. So, my assumption is 6570 is an interface, right? If I’m wrong, sorry.

Read full topic
